info.title: DataElementHub Rest API
info.description:
REST API Documentation!

  Github repositories:

<https://github.com/mig-frankfurt/dataelementhub.dal>

<https://github.com/mig-frankfurt/dataelementhub.model>

<https://github.com/mig-frankfurt/dataelementhub.rest>

<https://github.com/mig-frankfurt/dataelementhub.gui>

Contact:

tags.name: Namespace
tags.description: Namespaces are organizational units that contain sets of dataelements, dataelementgroups and/or records. Create and modify your own namespace with the endpoints here.

tags.name: Element
tags.description: The endpoints here allow to create, read, update and delete any kind of dataelements that can be stored in the DEHub - dataelements, dataelementgroups, records, value domains and permitted values.

tags.name: Element Relations
tags.description: Elements can be related to other elements - either in the same instance or in other DEHub instances. Those relations can be defined, read and modified via those endpoints.

tags.name: Export
tags.description:
You can export your metadata in XMl or JSON format with a single request, via our most optimized export endpoint with integrated data validation mechanism. The exported metadata--which will be provided as a .zip file--can include data elements, data element groups, records, value domains or whole namespaces.
 After an export is requested, it will build in the background. The eventual .zip can then be downloaded for up to 7 days. 
 The two-step export flow consists of:

1. Export request to start the process in the background.
2. Download the generated export file when the process is completed.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: You can search for DEHub elements and filter the results based on element type, element status, specified element parts and much more.

tags.name: Import
tags.description:
DEHub enables you to bring along your existing metadata and import it into one of your namespaces. We provide a structured workflow to migrate your metadata over, including all details and relations. This allow you to store, edit and extend your metadata at the same place.
 The import to DEHub is a two-step process:

1. Provide XML/JSON file and start the import process. This stores all elements in the staging area.
2. Convert your imported elements to drafts and assign them to one of your namespaces.

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

400.description: There was a problem with your request.

404.description: The namespace identifier does not exist or you do not have the required permission to release it.

get.summary: Get all Namespaces

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Limit the list of namespaces to those you have a certain access level on

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Define whether you want a detailed response (default) or a condensed response (listview)

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Define the languages you want to receive the definitions in (if available)

Location.description: The full path to your newly created namespace.

403.description: You do not have sufficient access rights to create a namespace

422.description: The namespace you provided contains errors.

get.summary: Get the members of a namespace.

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Define the languages you want to receive the definitions in (if available)

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Define whether you want a detailed response (default) or a condensed response (listview)

parameters.name: elementType
parameters.description: Define which kind of elements you would like to retrieve. If omitted, all kinds of elements will be sent.

parameters.name: hideSubElements
parameters.description: When true, only members that are NOT part of another structure (dataelementgroup/record) are returned.

401.description: You have no read access on this namespace.

get.summary: Read user access to namespace by namespace identifier.

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

401.description: Unauthorized - you need to provide an access token

403.description: Access is forbidden - you do not have sufficient rights to read the user list (must be namespace admin)

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

401.description: Unauthorized - you need to provide an access token

403.description: Access is forbidden - you do not have sufficient rights to update the user list (must be namespace admin)

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

parameters.name: userAuthId
parameters.description: The keycloak id of the user to remove access from.

401.description: Unauthorized - you need to provide an access token

403.description: Access is forbidden - you do not have sufficient rights to delete user access (must be namespace admin)

404.description: Namespace id not found or user id not found.

get.summary: Get Namespace by id.

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

parameters.name: namespaceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the scoped identifier of the namespace.

400.description: Bad request. If an illegal status change shall be done

403.description: You do not have sufficient access rights on the namespace

409.description: The namespace is already marked as deleted

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: The URN of the element that shall be released.

422.description: The element can not be released because either the element is outdated or the namespace it is in is not released, its value domain is not yet released or, if it is a dataelementgroup or a record, it contains members that are not released.

post.summary: Update dataElementGroup or record members by urn.

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: The URN of the dataelementgroup or record whose members shall be updated

Location.description: The full path to your updated element.

400.description: Element Type is not supported. Only dataelementgroup and record are accepted

403.description: User has no write access to the namespace

get.summary: Get Element by URN.

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: The URN of the element to retrieve

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Define the languages you want to receive the definitions in (if available)

put.summary: Update an Element with one of the models Dataelement, Dataelementgroup or Record.

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: The URN of the element to update

requestBody.description: The element to update in JSON format

Location.description: The full path to your updated element

400.description: Your request makes no sense - e.g. trying to change status from released to draft.

403.description: You do not have the necessary access rights to this element

406.description: Updating validation is currently not supported.

422.description: Your request can not be fulfilled, e.g. because you are trying to set a namespace to released, but it contains unreleased elements.

501.description: Updating released value domains is currently not supported.

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: The URN of the element that shall be deleted

get.summary: Get Element Relations.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify one or more element types to retrieve. If none is specified, all relations are returned

400.description: You submitted one or more unknown relation types.
Element relation could not be deleted. Either it was not found or you do not have the right to do so.
An error occurred trying to post element relations
An error occurred trying to update element relations

get.summary: Retrieves the details of all available imports, including import status, timestamp and the percentage amount of staged/converted elements in each import.

post.summary: Start the asynchronous import process. This is the first half of the two-step import flow, which stores all imported elements into the staging area.

parameters.name: namespaceUrn
parameters.description: Assign the import to one of your namespaces using its urn.

Location.description: The full path to your processed import.

401.description: Unauthorized. Only users with WRITE or ADMIN accessLevel can import to the specified namespace.

400.description: Bad Request. The provided import ID does not exist.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. DEHub is unable to process the provided file, check the response message for more info.

delete.summary: Delete an existing import by Id. Deleting an import means all staged element from this import can not be converted to drafts anymore. Already converted elements are not affected.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import. You can only enter one of your own imports.

403.description: Forbidden. Access to this resource is not permitted.

404.description: Not Found. The provided import ID does not exist.

get.summary: Get import info by Id, including namespaceUrn, import status, timestamp and the percentage amount of staged/converted elements in this particular import.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import. You can only enter one of your own imports.

403.description: Forbidden. Access to this resource is not permitted.

404.description: Not Found. The provided import ID does not exist.

get.summary: Return a JSON response containing all members of the specified import. The response can be filtered based on the conversion status (STAGED/CONVERTED) and based on the structure in the namespace (e.g. hide an element if it is a part of a dataElementGroup or a record)

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import. You can only enter one of your own imports.

parameters.name: hideSubElements
parameters.description: Hide all elements that are included in one or multiple dataElementGroup(s)/record(s). Default is false.

parameters.name: onlyConverted
parameters.description: Return only elements that are converted to drafts. Default is false.

403.description: Forbidden. Access to this resource is not permitted.

404.description: Not Found. The provided import ID does not exist.

get.summary: Get an imported element from the staging area. This endpoint requires import ID and element urn.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import. You can only enter one of your own imports.

parameters.name: stagedElementId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the stagedElement. Note that this element should be a part of the specified import.

403.description: Forbidden. Access to this resource is not permitted.

404.description: Not Found. The provided import ID does not exist.

get.summary: Returns a JSON response containing all members of an imported element. The response can be filtered based on the conversion status (e.g. return only converted members).

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import. You can only choose one of your own imports.

parameters.name: stagedElementId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the stagedElement. Note that this element should be a part of the specified import.

parameters.name: onlyConverted
parameters.description: Return only elements that are converted to drafts. Default is false.

403.description: Forbidden. Access to this resource is not permitted.

404.description: Not Found. The provided import ID does not exist.

post.summary: Convert one or more imported elements from the staging area to drafts.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import. You can only choose one of your own imports.

post.summary: Start the asynchronous export process of existing DEHUB elements. This is the first half of the two-step export flow, which provide you eventually with export file in JSON or XML format.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Export the elements in this file format (e.g. choose XML to generate XML export file).

parameters.name: fullExport
parameters.description: Full export contains all available element revisions, even if they are OUTDATED (e.g. pass false to export only RELEASED elements)

Location.description: The full path to your generated export file.

400.description: Bad Request. Export from more than one namespace is forbidden.

501.description: Not Implemented. Export can only be processed in JSON or XML format.

get.summary: Retrieves the details of all available exports, including export id, status and timestamp

Retrieves the details of an export that has previously been started by ID. If the export process is finished this endpoint will provide the final export file (XML/JSON). This is the second half of the two-step export flow, where you have to start the export process first.

parameters.name: exportId
parameters.description: Only return details/exportFile for the given exportID.

parameters.name: onlyUrns
parameters.description: Return complete elements or just element urns (e.g. pass true to return only element urns).

200.description: Success. The export process is completed.

Content-Disposition.description: The name of your export file.

202.description: Accepted. The export ID is valid and the process is still running in the background.

404.description: Not Found. The provided export ID does not exist or the export is older than 7 days and it can not be downloaded anymore.

get.summary: Returns a JSON response containing details for elements that match the query parameters, without limitations for query length.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query string.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The array of element types to include in the response. If omitted, the response will include all available element types.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The array of status to include in the response. If omitted, the response will include all available status.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: The array of element sections to include in the response. If omitted, the response will include all available element sections.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. DEHub is unable to process at least one of the provided element parts.
